channel.title: math.GT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Functoriality of Odd and Generalized Khovanov Homology in $\mathbb{R}^3\times I$
item.description: arXiv:2410.23455v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We extend the generalized Khovanov bracket to smooth link cobordisms in $\mathbb{R}^3\times I$ and prove that the resulting theory is functorial up to global invertible scalars. The generalized Khovanov bracket can be specialized to both even and odd Khovanov homology. Particularly by setting $\pi=-1$, we obtain that odd Khovanov homology is functorial up to sign. We end by showing that odd Khovanov homology is not functorial under smooth link cobordisms in $S^3\times I$.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Migdail, Stephan Wehrli

item.title: Remarks on Fixed Point Assertions in Digital Topology, 9
item.description: arXiv:2410.23459v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We continue a discussion of published assertions that are incorrect, incorrectly proven, or trivial, in the theory of fixed points in digital topology.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Boxer

item.title: Effective bounds on characterising slopes for all knots
item.description: arXiv:2410.24209v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A slope $p/q$ is characterising for a knot $K \subset \mathbb{S}^3$ if the orientation-preserving homeomorphism type of the manifold $\mathbb{S}^3_K(p/q)$ obtained by performing Dehn surgery of slope $p/q$ along $K$ uniquely determines the knot $K$. We combine new applications of results from hyperbolic geometry with previous individual work of the authors to determine, for any given knot $K$, an explicit bound $\mathcal{C}(K)$ such that $|q| > \mathcal{C}(K)$ implies that $p/q$ is a characterising slope for $K$.
item.dc:creator: Patricia Sorya, Laura Wakelin

item.title: Infinitely many closed paths in the graph of Anosov flows
item.description: arXiv:2410.23551v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: For an Anosov flow on a closed 3-manifold, we are interested in the problem of whether or not making non-trivial Fried surgeries along a finite set of periodic orbits can produce a flow equivalent to itself. We show that for some suspension Anosov flows, there exist infinitely many pairs of periodic orbits satisfying this property.
item.dc:creator: Mario Shannon

item.title: The Tangle Hypothesis
item.description: arXiv:2410.23965v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We introduce an $(\infty,1)$-category ${\sf Bord}_1^{\sf fr}(\mathbb{R}^n)$, the morphisms in which are framed tangles in $\mathbb{R}^n\times \mathbb{D}^1$. We prove that ${\sf Bord}_1^{\sf fr}(\mathbb{R}^n)$ has the universal mapping out property of the 1-dimensional Tangle Hypothesis of Baez--Dolan and Hopkins--Lurie: it is the rigid $\mathcal{E}_n$-monoidal $(\infty,1)$-category freely generated by a single object. Applying this theorem to a dualizable object of a braided monoidal $(\infty,1)$-category gives link invariants, generalizing the Reshetikhin--Turaev invariants.
item.dc:creator: David Ayala, John Francis

item.title: Modular vector fields in non-commutative geometry
item.description: arXiv:2410.24064v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We construct a non-commutative analogue of the modular vector field on a Poisson manifold for a given pair of a double bracket and a connection on a space of 1-forms. As an application, we give an algebraic description of the framed, groupoid version of Turaev's loop operation $\mu$ similar to the one obtained by Alekseev--Kawazumi--Kuno--Naef and the author. The key ingredient for the modular vector field, the triple divergence map, is directly constructed from a connection on a linear category to deal with multiple base points.
item.dc:creator: Toyo Taniguchi

item.title: Monopole Invariants for Webs and Foams
item.description: arXiv:2311.03336v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We develop a package of monopole Floer-theoretic invariants for webs and foams using real Seiberg-Witten theory with orbifold singularities, based on Kronheimer and Mrowka's framework of monopole Floer homology.
item.dc:creator: Jiakai Li

item.title: Topological Hyperbolicity of Moduli spaces of Elliptic Surfaces
item.description: arXiv:2103.12490v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We introduce the notion of topological hyperbolicity to characterize the largeness of the topological fundamental group of a complex variety. Inspired by the Shafarevich conjecture, we propose to study the topological hyperbolicity of moduli spaces of polarized manifolds. We provide two pieces of supporting evidence: first, we show that moduli spaces where the infinitesimal Torelli theorem holds are very close to being topologically hyperbolic. Second, we establish a weak form of topological hyperbolicity for moduli spaces of elliptic surfaces of Kodaira dimension one without multiple fibers, where the infinitesimal Torelli theorem generally does not hold.
item.dc:creator: Xin L\"u, Ruiran Sun, Kang Zuo

item.title: Algebraically overtwisted tight $3$-manifolds from $+1$ surgeries
item.description: arXiv:2403.19982v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We execute Avdek's algorithm to find many algebraically overtwisted and tight $3$-manifolds by contact $+1$ surgeries. In particular, we show that a contact $1/k$ surgery on the standard contact $3$-sphere along any positive torus knot with the maximum Thurston-Bennequin invariant yields an algebraically overtwisted and tight $3$-manifold, where $k$ is a positive integer.
item.dc:creator: Youlin Li, Zhengyi Zhou
